author: Анна Пацула
title: Из жизни ушел экс-президент «Иртыша» Станислав Аванесов
text:
Ему было 75 лет.
Накануне, 16 июля, стало известно о кончине Станислава Аванесова, ветерана омского спорта, бывшего президента футбольного клуба «Иртыш» и директора спорткомплекса «Красная звезда». О трагическом событии сообщила Омская городская федерация футбола.
Станислав Аванесов родился и вырос в Омске, посвятив свою жизнь развитию спорта в регионе. В 1971 году он окончил Омский государственный институт физической культуры и спорта, получив квалификацию тренера-преподавателя по хоккею.
На протяжении многих лет Станислав Георгиевич занимал ключевые посты в омских спортивных организациях, оставив яркий след в истории каждой из них. Он работал директором спортивно-концертного комплекса имени Виктора Блинова, парка культуры и отдыха «Советский», а также спорткомплекса «Красная звезда».
Также Станислав Аванесов был членом президиума Омской городской федерации футбола и инициатором создания футбольного музея в манеже спорткомплекса «Красная звезда».
Редакция «ОМСКРЕГИОНА» выражает соболезнования родным и близким Станислава Аванесова.

author: @wtvm
title: Chattahoochee river pollution prompts legal action in Phenix City
text:
Chattahoochee river pollution prompts legal action in Phenix City
Phenix City, Ala. (WTVM) - A state lawsuit has been joined by the Chattahoochee Riverkeeper against Phenix City, alleging pollution violations stemming from the city’s Wastewater Treatment Plant.
The lawsuit, which was filed in 2024, claims that the plant has been in violation of the federal Clean Water Act and the Alabama Water Pollution Control Act. According to the filing, these alleged violations have resulted in untreated or improperly treated waste being discharged into the Chattahoochee River.
Reports from 2023 indicated that foamy discharge, accompanied by a strong odor and sanitary items, was observed near the plant’s outflow pipes. As stated by the Chattahoochee Riverkeeper, routine water testing has revealed elevated bacteria levels in the surrounding area.
Public records have shown that the facility has been in violation of pollution limits on a regular basis since 2020.
The lawsuit is currently ongoing, and further legal proceedings are expected to address the environmental concerns raised by the Riverkeeper and state officials.
Copyright 2025 WTVM. All rights reserved.

author: www.ETHospitalityWorld.com
title: Solid, strong growth to continue for at least next five years: Ajay Bakaya, ET HospitalityWorld
text: managing director for Sarovar Hotels & Resorts, and director of Louvre Hotels India.Around 37 new signings in one year and nine new openings, 2023 has been a productive year for Sarovar Hotels & Resorts, which currently has 105 operational hotels in the country. The hotel company has also got the distinction of opening the first international branded hotel - Park Inn by Radisson, in Ayodhya recently, the city which is set to become a hub for spiritual tourism in India with the grand opening scheduled next month. “2023 was by and large a year of positive growth for the hospitality industry in India. We expect to close the year with around 12 percent growth and hope to continue and sustain the growth in the range of 10 to 12 percent in the coming year as well, considering the rate of inflation remains in the range of 6 to 7 percent,” said Bakaya in a telephonic interaction with ET HospitalityWorld.Bakaya said that the company has a pipeline of 45 hotels and expects at least a dozen new openings in 2024. While 2023 was a record growth year for the hospitality sector in the country, there were exceptions in the overall growth story, which Bakaya didn’t forget to mention as well as highlight. The most important is the inbound scenario, which is yet to look up despite hosting big ticket international events like G20. “International inbound is still a trickle. We expected it to improve from this winter, but it didn't happen,” he said.Secondly, the slow growth in the most important demand driving sector - IT. This, according to Bakaya, impacted the performance of the hospitality sector in key cities like Bengaluru. He hopes the situation will improve in the New Year.The floods and landslides in the Himalayan states of Himachal and Uttarakhand was another dampener for the industry. Business was affected for almost three months because of the natural calamities, he says.While domestic travel has been the mainstay for Indian hotels in the post-Covid era, the allurement of visa free entry by various South East Asian countries to Indian tourists could play spoilsport to domestic demand going forward, Bakaya shared his concern. At the same time, he hopes the Modi-magic to work well for India in arresting the floodgates of destination weddings going out of India. The call given by PM Modi for ‘Wed in India’, he hopes, would convert into business opportunities for the Indian hospitality sector going forward. As the country will be going into general elections in the early part of 2024, Bakaya expects “political continuity” for the country, which is quite integral for the growth of trade and industry as well as the economy.Conceding that the challenge on the human resource side would continue to pester the sector for some time more as the youth in the country doesn’t see hospitality job “as attractive” enough, Bakaya called for measures from the industry to “make the hospitality jobs attractive” by offering flexi jobs, leniency in terms of leaves, better emoluments, etc. “We have to bend and be more flexible,” he said. He also proposes “building own army” through management training programmes, talent development programmes, etc.

author: @gazetadopovo
title: Silenciar a fé: o Ocidente diante da criminalização da oração
text:
Ouça este conteúdo
Recentemente, durante a 61.ª Conferência de Segurança de Munique, o vice-presidente dos Estados Unidos, J.D. Vance, trouxe à tona uma inquietante realidade: a crescente repressão à liberdade religiosa e de expressão no Ocidente. O caso emblemático de Adam Smith-Connor, veterano do exército britânico, ilustra essa preocupante tendência.
Em novembro de 2022, Smith-Connor foi abordado por policiais enquanto orava silenciosamente próximo a uma clínica de aborto em Bournemouth, Inglaterra. Sem interagir ou obstruir qualquer pessoa, sua ação foi considerada uma violação de uma “zona de proteção” estabelecida ao redor da clínica. Em outubro de 2024, o Tribunal de Magistrados de Bournemouth declarou-o culpado, impondo-lhe uma dispensa condicional e ordenando o pagamento de custas processuais no valor de 9 mil libras (aproximadamente R$ 66 mil)
Defendido pela ADF International, organização que atua na proteção das liberdades fundamentais e parceira do Instituto Brasileiro de Direito e Religião (IBDR) no Brasil, Smith-Connor decidiu apelar da decisão, com audiência marcada para julho de 2025.
Quando a oração silenciosa se torna crime, todos devemos refletir sobre os rumos que nossas sociedades estão tomando
O vice-presidente Vance, em seu discurso, destacou: “O governo britânico acusou [Smith-Connor] do crime ‘hediondo’ de ficar a 50 metros de uma clínica de aborto e orar silenciosamente por três minutos. Sem obstruir ninguém, sem interagir com ninguém, só orar silenciosamente por conta própria”. Essa declaração ressalta a gravidade da situação, em que pensamentos e orações silenciosas são tratados como infrações criminais.
Esse episódio evidencia uma alarmante tendência de intolerância secularista, em que manifestações pacíficas de fé são reprimidas em nome de uma suposta neutralidade estatal. No entanto, é fundamental lembrar que a laicidade do Estado não implica a exclusão da religião do espaço público, mas sim a garantia de que todas as crenças possam coexistir harmoniosamente. No Brasil, por exemplo, a “laicidade colaborativa” é um modelo que promove a cooperação entre Estado e instituições religiosas em prol do bem comum, sem privilegiar ou discriminar qualquer credo.
O Ocidente precisa despertar para essas violações às liberdades de religião, crença e expressão. A criminalização de atos como uma oração silenciosa representa uma ameaça não apenas aos indivíduos de fé, mas a todos que valorizam os direitos fundamentais. É imperativo que levantemos nossas vozes em defesa de uma laicidade que não seja sinônimo de intolerância, mas que reconheça e respeite a diversidade de convicções em nossa sociedade.
A liberdade religiosa é um pilar essencial das democracias modernas. Permitir que ela seja erodida por interpretações restritivas e políticas repressivas é abrir mão de valores que sustentam nossas sociedades livres. Devemos, portanto, promover uma laicidade colaborativa, onde Estado e religião dialoguem e cooperem, garantindo espaço para todas as manifestações de fé, sem imposições ou censuras.
O caso de Adam Smith-Connor serve como um alerta: quando a oração silenciosa se torna crime, todos devemos refletir sobre os rumos que nossas sociedades estão tomando e agir em defesa das liberdades que tanto prezamos.
Conteúdo editado por: Marcio Antonio Campos

author: Shaila Rosagel
title: Sequía seguirá en Sonora con ‘La Niña’; prevén menos agua | Noticias de Sonora | El Imparcial
text: Sequía seguirá en Sonora con ‘La Niña’; prevén menos agua Este fenómeno, que se espera en septiembre, perjudicará a la entidad. CIUDAD DE MÉXICO.- La sequía y falta de lluvias continuarán en Sonora al menos hasta junio, cuando el monzón brinde un poco de humedad, pero regresará con la entrada del [ fenómeno “La Niña”](https://www.elimparcial.com/mundo/2021/10/18/la-nina-esta-de-regreso-que-es-y-que-significa-para-el-clima-en-america-latina/) en septiembre, el cual no beneficiará a la entidad, sino la perjudicará con menos agua. Reynaldo Pascual Ramírez, jefe de Proyectos de Pronóstico Estacional del Servicio Meteorológico Nacional (SMN), dijo en entrevista con Grupo Healy que hay un 74% de probabilidad que entre a México el fenómeno de “La Niña” en los meses de septiembre, octubre y noviembre y que tendrá su pico máximo en el invierno 2024-2025. Pero para la zona Norte del País no les trae demasiada humedad, sino menos humedad de la esperada”, dijo. En Sonora hay una declaración de emergencia por la sequía desde el 22 de febrero y [presas, como la Abelardo L. Rodríguez, lucen secas y desoladas al cero por ciento de su capacidad.](https://www.elimparcial.com/videos/2024/03/22/la-presa-de-hermosillo-luce-desolada-emergencia-hidrica-en-mexico/) De acuerdo con la Coordinación Estatal de Protección Civil hay emergencia hídrica en 69 de los 72 municipios de Sonora, pues según el Monitor de Sequía hay 24 municipios en sequía excepcional y 37 extrema. Hermosillo, Cajeme, Guaymas, Navojoa, Empalme, Etchojoa, Mazatán, Sahuaripa, San Pedro de la Cueva, Yécora, Tepache y Villa Hidalgo se encuentran con sequía excepcional. EXPECTATIVA Prevén se registre este año el fenómeno “La Niña”. 74% DE PROBABILIDAD QUE ENTRE A MÉXICO “LA NIÑA”. - Septiembre, octubre y noviembre serían los meses en que se presentaría. - Tendrá su pico máximo en el invierno 2024-2025. EN 69 DE LOS 72 MUNICIPIOS DE SONORA HAY EMERGENCIA HÍDRICA. Fuente: SMN y CEPC.

author: OneAdmin
title: Retired Marine and cancer survivor celebrates remission with 10-hour swim
text:
COLORADO SPRINGS, Colo. ( KKTV /Gray News) - A retired Marine and cancer survivor in Colorado celebrates the anniversary of his remission with a feat he picked up during his service.
Michael LaBarge said he was diagnosed with glioblastoma multiforme, grade IV brain cancer, 21 years ago on April 2.
LaBarge said he has been in remission for a while and that he swims for 10 hours on the anniversary to celebrate it.
“The prognosis was two weeks to 10 months … 21 years ago,” he told KKTV . “I did this a lot in the Marines. [Today,] I started at 6 a.m., stopping at 4 p.m.”
He completed his swim this year at the U.S. Air Force Academy’s Community Pool in Colorado Springs.
Chris Gesterling, the USAFA Pool Aquatics Manager, said he often sees LaBarge at the pool, and his story of surviving cancer is inspiring.
“Former Marine ... you know, he beat brain cancer so everything is possible for him,” Gesterling said.
As LaBarge swam, he also shared his message for those fighting similar battles to the one he faced.
“Hopefully, this will inspire people with cancer to get out, stay active and, you know, don’t get too down on themselves,” he said.
Copyright 2024 KKTV via Gray Media Group, Inc. All rights reserved.

author: Michael Hemsworth
title: Multifunctional Traveler Speakers - The Harman Kardon 'Traveler' Speaker Has an Elegant Form (TrendHunter.com)
text:
The Harman Kardon 'Traveler' speaker is a multifunctional audio accessory perfect for jet setters and avid mobile users alike to help them stay connected no matter where their next adventure takes them.
The unit features a sleek form factor that draws on the design language of the tech brand and is capable of pumping out rich, high-quality audio at leisure. The speaker is rated to provide up to 10-hours of playback per charge, but also functions as a power bank to help listeners power up their smartphone, if desired.
The Harman Kardon 'Traveler' speaker has been designed by Sunghyun (Teddy) Hwang, and comes in black, silver and electric blue finish options. Paired with a premium carrying pouch, the speaker will match existing technology products seamlessly.
The Harman Kardon 'Traveler' Speaker Has an Elegant Form
[Michael Hemsworth](/Michael.Hemsworth)— December 28, 2023 — [Art & Design](/artdesign)
References:
behance.net& yankodesign
Trend Themes
1. Multifunctional Audio Accessories - The Harman Kardon 'Traveler' speaker is part of a trend of multifunctional audio accessories that cater to the needs of jet setters and mobile users.
2. Sleek and Portable Design - The sleek form factor of the Harman Kardon 'Traveler' speaker reflects a trend towards portable audio devices with an elegant aesthetic.
3. Powerful and Versatile Speakers - The Harman Kardon 'Traveler' speaker taps into the trend of powerful and versatile speakers that offer high-quality audio playback and can also function as power banks.
Industry Implications
1. Consumer Electronics - The rise of multifunctional audio accessories like the Harman Kardon 'Traveler' speaker presents new opportunities for innovation in the consumer electronics industry.
2. Travel and Leisure - The travel-friendly design of the Harman Kardon 'Traveler' speaker aligns with the evolving needs of the travel and leisure industry, providing an opportunity for collaboration.
3. Mobile Technology - The integration of a power bank function in the Harman Kardon 'Traveler' speaker highlights the potential for innovation at the intersection of mobile technology and audio accessories.
